page.title: 17Religion-St Martin's Church
page.content: The first church was built in 1304 and destroyed in 1703. The present church was built in 1714. William de Sale was the first rector. Music was once provided by an orchestra. The present organ was built in 1857. A gallery, built in 1743 for a growing congregation, still exists. The baptistry, built on poor foundations, is falling away from the main building .The tower, vestries and lych gate were added in 1887 to mark Queen Victoria's Jubilee. The timbered roof in hammer beam style dates from 1714. We asked children in our school if they attend a church or Sunday school; 48% do. The majority attend the United Reformed Church. Other churches in our area are Church of England, congregational, Methodist, Evangelical, and Roman Catholic.
